substring

Mar 03 2008 | WordPressBackup

You cannot get the substring which is in the tail using a negative index like this: a = "1234" b = a[-2:0]

This is the right statement:

b = a[-2:]

Differently, you'll feel free when you use the positive indexes:

b = a[2:4]

The second index can be replaced by any positive number which is bigger than len(a), and it can be ignored too:

b = a[2:]

Actually, this is the recommend solution. It's a tricky problem, you should be very carefully when you calculate the indexes.
